positive.review: I love sniper elite resistence, as  new gamer I picked it up quite easy. However, I started on 5 and feel a little ripped off with the survival maps from 5 being reused on a game I paid new game dollar for and the fact that nearly a year after the games release there are still bugs in the maps.
It seems a bit redundant being similar to Sniper Elite 5, with a few small changes from its predecessor, which isn't necessarily the worst thing that could happen.

A solid return for the series. Sniping feels amazing as always, with satisfying ballistics and brutal kill-cams. The missions give you multiple ways to approach targets, and the stealth gameplay is actually rewarding. It’s not perfect, but if you enjoy tactical shooters and slow, planned combat, this one is definitely worth playing.

8/10

A nice, slow paced action game where your willingness to perform thorough reconnaissance is well rewarded, and simple mistakes will result in having to change position very quickly. It's fun setting traps, distracting enemies, timing your shots to be masked and such. I had a great time playing carefully through the campaign.
Nice single player gameplay but i wish it had a bigger story and more maps!

Game is not bad by itself, gameplay is everything u knew from previous titles in the series, the only new addition is Propaganda missions. Game, as usual with Asura engine lacks proper anti-alliasing option, unless u playing on 4k resolution. Biggest downsight is the fact that developers just decided to recycle some maps from SE 5. If u gonna buy it on bigger sale, u gonna be satisfied.

i enjoy it , the only thing that bugs me is when you have to keep running around after youve killed everybody just to find some files , it seems to happen quite often that they create a maze of rooms and corridors that dont lead you where they should .

If you are wondering should you buy this game, yes and no. I personally like the game and its spin on the Resistance point of view.  The missions are fun to play and theres couple new items such as the (shock granade)& (exploding bullets) more ways to play missions. I do like the use of the familiar weapon wheel and other menu's from SE5 they work well. The story is well writen and interesting. Overall i like it, however there is some issues.
- Some places your character might get stuck while crouching or laying down.
- Graphics look weird sometimes.
Others complain the game feels rushed and empty but i dont get that feeling other than the few bugs. There might be more but thats what im noticing, Not game breaking for me but annoying for sure. I do hope the issues are fixed but because of those i can't recommend the game at full price. If you can get a discount then absolutely get it if not dont buy. Will update review after playing DLC missions.

What you're getting with Sniper Elite: Resistance, is basically more Sniper Elite 5. New maps, new guns (to a degree) and more of the same tried and tested gameplay.

For me, this was perfectly adequate this time around. Graphics and gameplay hold up well and the game was perfectly enjoyable, although I did get a very slight feeling of "been there, done that".

I would really love to see future games cater a bit more to a proper long range shooting experience. On the simulation difficulty setting, it would be great to have some real mechanics for the player to gauge distance instead of just displaying a number in the binos. Maybe better wind gauging mechanics, instead of a line in the scope.

Whatever updates they choose to go with, I do hope for a little innovation from future titles but if you have enjoyed the Sniper Elite series so far, you won't go far wrong with this one.

The overall experience feels incredibly unpolished, with awkward movement mechanics that detract from the gameplay. Character navigation feels clunky, especially when trying to vault over small obstacles or maneuver around minor rubble and debris. This lack of fluidity gives the game an outdated, almost early-2000s feel, which is a significant step back from previous Sniper Elite titles.

I’m glad I didn’t pay more than $20 for it, because this entry feels like a downgrade, rather than an upgrade, compared to its predecessors. To make matters worse, the game has been monetized to the point where additional DLCs, which should have been part of the base game, are being sold as extra content. The inclusion of paid skins and levels feels like a cash grab, undermining the core experience.

It’s disappointing to see what was once a standout franchise take such a turn. It feels like the end of an era for Sniper Elite.

Don't waste your money!   To be fair....IF you are going to play this SOLO, then it looks like it would be fun to play, like the other Sniper Elite games.  HOWEVER...if you plan on playing this in co-op with a friend..forget it.  The anti-cheat, or should I say, anti-playable Denovu crap, makes the game unplayable.  It queues up the movement keys so bad, that when you release the key, the character continues to move for anywhere from 7-10 seconds longer.  So off a cliff, into the enemy lines, what ever direction you were heading.  And don't plan on the Devs doing anything about it.  I got an email from them basically saying, it's ok that I got a refund...have a good day. 
And before anyone asks, YES I tried every recommended fix/alteration to correct the issue.  The ONLY thing that fixed the issue, was removing Denovu.
Have a great day guys!

It's an OK game, but essentially it's just more of the same and the story is even worse than in the Sniper Elite 5.

This series has a good gameplay foundation, but they NEED to evolve in terms of story/mission quality and variety and, even more, in setting diversification. I will not buy another WW2 Sniper Elite game, but i would gladly buy one with a setting in Vietnam war, Korea war, Winter War or any other fresh setting and good story.

Feels rushed. Story feels dull and shallow. The detail is missing. And I don't get why the protagonist sounds like a tough male but is portrayed as a corpulent shy teen with acne. Maybe the developers felt like that would match their playerbase more. Very rude.

Areas feel empty. I have the idea that there are significantly lesser enemies in the game then previous installments. (My settings are the same). I could easily Rambo myself through the missions, because the lack of enemies made tagging and sniping very boring.

After completion no urge to replay any mission. Think i'm going to play and ES5 again and gaze in awe of the detailed interiors of bunkers and the masses of AI enemies.

If you liked the series and want to give this one a try, best to buy it in a sale!

I was looking forward to this game. But I should have waited to buy it. I'm actually kinda angry with myself for buying it on release. When Sniper Elite 4 was released, I enjoyed it but I couldn't help but feel "Huh, this just kinda feels like Sniper Elite 3..."  But there was a more stuff, an interesting story, and I found myself pleasantly invested.

When 5 came out, I'm gonna be honest. It felt like the EXACT same game as Sniper Elite 4. Everything felt the same, looked the same, the maps were BIGGER but I kinda was getting tired of every level being a sneaking mission. I was hoping to see some WWII combat with support sniping. Meet with Allied soldiers and work your way across enemy lines. But it was just another "Nazi Evil Secret Plan must be stopped."  Which... is fine?  I just wanted more.

Then this game came out, and not only do I HATE the characters, but like others have said it feels like a DLC to 5 being released at full game price. I've reached the end as a fan of this series I think... unless the next one (if there's a next one) does something incredibly different. I'll probably skip it.

At least put in new textures, fonts, menu, skill system, literally anything different. Only ever conceivably worth if it is on sale.

So this is a odd review. The game itself is perfect. More Sniper Elite gameplay. Nice amount of weapons, maps and modes. So why the bad rating? My game crashed every few minutes and I find out why. Denvuo. Once I reinstalled the game without it installed, the crashing went away. I contacted Rebellion and they tried blaming my M.2 drive it was installed on. I mean, I do get maybe thats an issue, even if I don't understand how. But the fact anti-cheat software crashes a game at all is a big issue for me. Now if I want to play online, I can't. Because the game crashes. 

Only good news is I got the deluxe version for $40 at another site. So I'm not to mad, I'm getting my moneys worth at least single player. Which honestly is the biggest part for me.

I mean, I do get maybe thats an issue, even if I don't understand how. But the fact anti-cheat software crashes a game at all is a big issue for me. Now if I want to play online, I can't. Because the game crashes. 

Only good news is I got the deluxe version for $40 at another site. So I'm not to mad, I'm getting my moneys worth at least single player. Which honestly is the biggest part for me.
Even worst than the SE5, the protagonist is so "carismatic" like Connor from AC3, very annoying, maps are shorter, is a DLC of 5 but much worst

Honestly more of an expansion to Sniper Elite 5 than a true new entry, which would be fine if it was cheaper, the levels are smaller and less interesting on average than SE5 and the new protagonist some how managed to be even less interesting than the old one... unless you can't get enough of the SE5 invasion mode buy on deep discount other wise just buy SE5 if you haven't already

After playing for just 3 minutes this looks, feels and IS the same sniper elite 5 with an annoying new voice and character.bring carl back, come up with something new, make huge maps with LOTS of targets.WASTE OF MONEY. SHAME REBELLION!  :(

The overall experience feels incredibly unpolished, with awkward movement mechanics that detract from the gameplay. Character navigation feels clunky, especially when trying to vault over small obstacles or maneuver around minor rubble and debris. This lack of fluidity gives the game an outdated, almost early-2000s feel, which is a significant step back from previous Sniper Elite titles.

I’m glad I didn’t pay more than $20 for it, because this entry feels like a downgrade, rather than an upgrade, compared to its predecessors. To make matters worse, the game has been monetized to the point where additional DLCs, which should have been part of the base game, are being sold as extra content. The inclusion of paid skins and levels feels like a cash grab, undermining the core experience.

It’s disappointing to see what was once a standout franchise take such a turn. It feels like the end of an era for Sniper Elite.
Bad copy of SE5. This is first Sniper Elite that is so doll, predictable.

I'd love another game with Harry Hawker as the protagonist, though, that was a fun element.

Very bare bones. Not as good as Sniper Elite 5. Feels very much like a cheap, rushed cash-grab. I was introduced to Sniper Elite 5 and became a fan. Thought I'd be excited for Rebellion's next game. Now I'm realizing they're just another soulless company run on DLC and greed. Gonna stay away from their company and games from now on.

Don't waste your money!   To be fair....IF you are going to play this SOLO, then it looks like it would be fun to play, like the other Sniper Elite games.  HOWEVER...if you plan on playing this in co-op with a friend..forget it.  The anti-cheat, or should I say, anti-playable Denovu crap, makes the game unplayable.  It queues up the movement keys so bad, that when you release the key, the character continues to move for anywhere from 7-10 seconds longer.  So off a cliff, into the enemy lines, what ever direction you were heading.  And don't plan on the Devs doing anything about it.  I got an email from them basically saying, it's ok that I got a refund...have a good day. 
And before anyone asks, YES I tried every recommended fix/alteration to correct the issue.  The ONLY thing that fixed the issue, was removing Denovu.
Have a great day guys!

It's an OK game, but essentially it's just more of the same and the story is even worse than in the Sniper Elite 5.

This series has a good gameplay foundation, but they NEED to evolve in terms of story/mission quality and variety and, even more, in setting diversification. I will not buy another WW2 Sniper Elite game, but i would gladly buy one with a setting in Vietnam war, Korea war, Winter War or any other fresh setting and good story.

Feels rushed. Story feels dull and shallow. The detail is missing. And I don't get why the protagonist sounds like a tough male but is portrayed as a corpulent shy teen with acne. Maybe the developers felt like that would match their playerbase more. Very rude.

Areas feel empty. I have the idea that there are significantly lesser enemies in the game then previous installments. (My settings are the same). I could easily Rambo myself through the missions, because the lack of enemies made tagging and sniping very boring.

After completion no urge to replay any mission. Think i'm going to play and ES5 again and gaze in awe of the detailed interiors of bunkers and the masses of AI enemies.

If you liked the series and want to give this one a try, best to buy it in a sale!

After being a long time since SE 3-4 on Switch and for a couple of month the current title,  (while still in dev) supporter no finally have to give up with feeling of sheer disgust and nausea. Game is crap, for it's unbalanced, ridiculuos in many aspects, saying in stumbling at crossing the futile puny obstacles like small fences whatnot, but what this shitty title is really shining is its idotic anti-cheating policies which allows the openly cheating persons to dominate over the field without any borders any punish poor (stupid) fair players for their consistency. I can say I've wiped it out and never will buy nothing from this team again.

I was looking forward to this game. But I should have waited to buy it. I'm actually kinda angry with myself for buying it on release. When Sniper Elite 4 was released, I enjoyed it but I couldn't help but feel "Huh, this just kinda feels like Sniper Elite 3..."  But there was a more stuff, an interesting story, and I found myself pleasantly invested.

When 5 came out, I'm gonna be honest. It felt like the EXACT same game as Sniper Elite 4. Everything felt the same, looked the same, the maps were BIGGER but I kinda was getting tired of every level being a sneaking mission. I was hoping to see some WWII combat with support sniping. Meet with Allied soldiers and work your way across enemy lines. But it was just another "Nazi Evil Secret Plan must be stopped."  Which... is fine?  I just wanted more.

Then this game came out, and not only do I HATE the characters, but like others have said it feels like a DLC to 5 being released at full game price. I've reached the end as a fan of this series I think... unless the next one (if there's a next one) does something incredibly different. I'll probably skip it.

Is SE5 with a pointless new character, talks to much, looks like a child, game is not finished, glitches galore. I could go on, but it's trash.
